name: backwardly
content:
backwardly adverb
(DIRECTION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
towards the direction that is the opposite to the one in which you are facing: If a cat's ears are backwardly turned, it may mean that the animal is angry or afraid. The tour guide was addressing us while walking backwardly and almost stepped into a puddle.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pawn is the only chess piece that cannot move backwardly.The country seemed to be moving backwardly based on what he was seeing on the news.

backwardly adverb
(MAKING WORSE)
in a way that is wrong or makes something worse: It is backwardly illogical to attack a country because you think it is wrong that they are attacking another country. The new laws are backwardly oppressive and out of touch with a progressive idea of freedom.
